item.title: HPC homework
item.description: Monte Carlo warm up Here we want to use Monte Carlo integration to reliably estimate pi to the 5th decimal place. By reliably, I mean correct to the 5th decimal place 97 out of 100 times. What we need to do is determine what sample size is required to do this, ie what N. The integral we are looking to estimate is: \[\begin{equation} I = \int_0^1 \sqrt{1-x^2} dx = \frac{\pi}{4} \end{equation}\]
